title: Serbians join anti-government protest following mass shootings
description: Tens of thousands demonstrate in Belgrade, calling on interior minister to resign following deadly mass shootings.

title: US says Iran is helping Russia build drone manufacturing facility
description: US intelligence officials say Iran and Russia continue to strengthen their military cooperation and weapons assistance.

title: Al-Shabab attack hotel in Somalia’s Mogadishu: State media
description: Several people have been injured in the attack on Friday evening around one of the capital's popular hang out spots.

title: Pakistan lays out budget but may not satisfy IMF
description: The 'plain-vanilla' budget is unlikely to satisfy IMF, which could lead to the South Asian nation defaulting on debt.

title: UK ex-Prime Minister Boris Johnson resigns as MP
description: Former PM accuses a parliamentary probe into the COVID-19 'Partygate' scandal of driving him out.

title: Should governments make breathing clean air a human right?
description: From New Delhi to Mexico City, there are few places on Earth where air pollution is not a problem.

title: One UN peacekeeper dead, four others injured in north Mali attack
description: More than 300 of the peacekeepers in MINUSMA have also been killed since the start of the Mali mission in 2013.

title: Newcastle announces shirt sponsorship deal with Saudi company
description: British media reports the deal is worth 25 million pounds ($31.5m) annually.

title: Colombia and ELN rebel group sign ceasefire agreement
description: The agreement is a significant success for President Gustavo Petro's agenda of 'total peace' after previous setbacks.

title: Djokovic beats cramping Alcaraz to reach French Open final
description: Carlos Alcaraz had levelled the contest when disaster struck as he limped to his bench holding his right leg.

title: Disney bets on free mobile cricket streaming in India
description: The strategy shift from Disney, which some analysts say is 'desperate', comes as rivalry with JioCinema heats up.

title: Blinken to take delayed China trip this month: Reports
description: US secretary of state is expected to meet top Chinese officials, US media outlets say, on visit delayed since February.

title: US bans imports from China-based Ninestar Corp over Uighurs
description: More than a million people, mainly Uighurs and Muslim minorities, are detained in camps in China's Xinjiang region.

title: South Korea summons China envoy over US ties remarks
description: China's ambassador accused Seoul of tilting excessively towards the US in a meeting with S Korea's opposition leader.

title: Sweden charges man suspected of financing outlawed Kurdish group
description: A Turkish citizen is charged in Sweden for gun crimes and raising money for the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).

title: Q&A: RSF adviser on Sudan ceasefire, Wagner and civilian killings
description: Ibrahim Mukhayer speaks to Al Jazeera about the allegations against the RSF and what would it take for the war to end.

title: Fighting in South Sudan camp leaves 13 displaced people dead: UN
description: South Sudan's Upper Nile State has recently become an epicentre of violence mainly orchestrated by militias.

title: Who is Hafize Gaye Erkan, Turkey’s new central bank chief?
description: Erkan becomes the first woman to lead the central bank after her appointment by President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

title: Rwandan genocide suspect faces more charges in South Africa
description: The suspect now faces 54 separate charges in South Africa relating to fraud and immigration offences, up from five.

title: Drone crashes into building in Russia’s Voronezh city; 3 injured
description: Russia reports a drone attack in its southwestern city which partially borders Ukraine.

title: Why are most US historians against Critical Race Theory?
description: Most of my colleagues appear determined to protect a version of our national history shaped by white supremacy.

title: Palestinian killed by Israeli forces at Rantis checkpoint
description: Twenty-nine-year-old Biadsa was killed as he arrived at the Rantis checkpoint in occupied West Bank.

title: Ex-US bank executive Hafize Erkan named Turkey central bank boss
description: Appointment seen as another indication that Erdogan may abandon policies that are widely branded as 'unorthodox'.

title: ‘Europeans are almost not coming to the UK any more’
description: Al Jazeera interviews social scientist Nando Sigona on migration trends.

title: Saudi Arabia, US announce 24-hour Sudan ceasefire from Saturday
description: Announcement by mediators says the ceasefire will begin at 6am local time (04:00 GMT).

title: Artificial intelligence without borders
description: The US border-industrial complex has joined the AI game.

title: Like US, UN suspends Ethiopia food aid over diversion of supplies
description: The UN agency's suspension of food aid to Ethiopia comes a day after USAID took similar action.

title: France’s Macron visits victims of Alps knife attack in hospital
description: The president visits victims as investigators seek to unravel the motive of the Syrian suspect after the park attack.

title: Palestinian President Abbas to visit China after mediation offer
description: Abbas will pay a state visit to China following's XI's pledge to work for a solution to the Palestinian issue.

title: What started Canada’s wildfires and are they under control?
description: Canada is battling its most devastating wildfire season on record, with ripple effects reaching as far as Norway.

title: Crisis-hit Pakistan set to present budget as IMF watches
description: Pakistan hopes budget will help unlock more than $2.5bn left in $6.5bn IMF bailout programme expiring this month.

title: EU members sign deal to overhaul asylum procedures
description: The accord will change how asylum seekers are processed at the bloc's borders and how they are relocated across Europe.

title: Record Mount Everest season in Nepal also one of its deadliest
description: Climbers say several of the 17 people killed or missing and presumed dead this season could have avoided the disaster.

title: In Russia-occupied Kherson, flood aid slow to come: Residents
description: Those in occupied areas are reportedly trapped in floodwaters as Ukrainians in Kyiv-controlled Kherson receive help.

title: ‘Enough is enough’: A UK union rep fighting from the picket line
description: For Mark Dollar, strike action against UK National Highways is not about the last 12 months, but the last 12 years.

title: Crypto giant Binance’s US arm suspends dollar deposits
description: Move comes days after US regulators announced 13 civil charges against Binance and its CEO Changpeng Zhao.

title: Lionel Messi’s move to Inter Miami sparks huge fan reaction
description: Inter's Instagram account quintupled since the World Cup champion revealed he will join the Major League Soccer club.

title: Rohingya in Bangladesh protest to be sent home after UN aid cut
description: Tens of thousands of refugees protest in Bangladesh camps, asking for repatriation to Myanmar after food ration slashed.

title: Donald Trump is doomed. Finally
description: The new indictments don't bar Trump from contesting but he will be bruised, battered and focused on staying out of jail.

title: What will it take to save the world’s insects?
description: Climate change, habitat loss, and pollution are having a dire impact on insect biodiversity.

title: Sudan declares UN envoy Volker Perthes ‘persona non grata’
description: UN chief Antonio Guterres said he was 'shocked' by request last month reportedly to replace special envoy to Sudan.

title: Thailand’s cannabis lovers face comedown amid legalisation U-turn
description: Southeast Asian country's booming cannabis industry is under a cloud as politicians reconsider decriminalisation.

title: ‘No one is above the law’: Reactions to Trump indictment
description: Republicans mostly react with fury to Trump's claim that he will be charged over the handling of classified documents.

title: Donald Trump’s indictment: What you need to know
description: Trump indictment remains sealed, but he is believed to be charged in relation to mishandling of classified documents.

title: A secret Chinese spy base? Cuban officials say no to media report
description: US and Cuban officials dismissed a Wall Street Journal report about a surveillance base to be built in the Caribbean.

title: Ukraine counteroffensive against Russia under way: think tank
description: US-based Institute for the Study of War says Ukraine counteroffensive likely to not unfold as 'single grand operation'.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 471
description: As the war enters it 471st day, these are the main developments.

title: Hong Kong touted rule of law. Now it won’t say what the law is
description: Officials are refusing to clarify what activities are legal, reflecting era of uncertainty under national security law.

title: Malaysia will ‘not survive’ if it does not change: Anwar Ibrahim
description: Malaysian prime minister tells Al Jazeera he is committed to reform, and fighting corruption in Southeast Asian nation.
